main event: Sighting of an unconventional aircraft over Columbus, Ohio observed by multiple witnesses on 31 July 1949.
interesting points: Witnesses reported seeing one or two round lights similar to floodlights giving off brilliant light like molten metal, The lights were observed traveling slowly in a southerly direction, A witness described the object as being oval-shaped and five times the size of a U.S. Navy aircraft, Two flares dropped from the object during the sighting, The event lasted approximately from 7:15 to 7:30 p.m.
witness description: civilians including a machinist and a motor oiler
